entities.description: The unweighted frequency of the data value recorded in the survey.
The type of the variable, which in this case is numeric.
The amount of data which is missing from the survey.
The total number of cases surveyed.
A categorized label for the number of offenders when the number is unknown.
Various statistical measures related to the data such as mean, median, mode, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation.
Location of the variables in the dataset specified by width and decimal places.
The range of missing values, specified as a list of potential values.

relationships.description: Relates survey data to its unweighted frequency counts.
Indicates the amount of missing data within the survey dataset.
Defines the type of the survey variable.
Indicates the total number of cases surveyed in the study.
Categorizes the number of offenders in situations where the number is unknown.
Provides various statistical measures related to the survey variable.
Specifies the location of the survey variable within the dataset.
Specifies the range of missing values for the survey variable.
